headline: Reinventing Rye Playland Ignites an Unexpected Battle
summary: Neighbors of the Art Deco amusement park, built in 1928 and run by Westchester County, object to planned additions like a large field house.

headline: Time Warner’s Profit Rises On Strength in Film Unit
summary: The growth from movie and cable businesses helped fuel a 9 percent increase in revenue to $7.5 billion, from $6.9 billion during the same period a year ago.

headline: With Online Video Offerings, the Establishment Plays the Upstart
summary: Ambitious efforts are being made by legacy media companies like Time Inc. to join the frenzy of online video content creation that was set off by so-called digital natives like AOL, BuzzFeed and others.

headline: Steve Jobs Defied Convention, and Perhaps the Law
summary: Mr. Jobs’s conduct is a reminder that the difference between genius and potentially criminal behavior can be a fine line.

headline: Sometimes, the Video Doesn’t Have to Go Viral
summary: The video was a flop — except that it doubled our revenue.

headline: Slate Raising Its Investment in Podcasts
summary: Slate is introducing two new podcasts at a time when other news publications have shrunk their podcast offerings in favor of video programming.
